header.title: Information Systems Engineer
header.subtitle: Full Stack Web Developer
ps: I'm a proactive developer who swiftly adapts to new challenges. My passion for creating and coding is matched by my commitment to learning continuously. With a proven record of crafting efficient solutions, I thrive in dynamic and collaborative environments, creating innovative software that makes an impact.

skills.description: All the way from server management and networking to coding and UI/UX.

description: I'm part of a Scrum team where I design, code, test, document, and integrate solutions, along with QA, architecture, and business teams for a health insurance software composed of several microservices communicating via SOAP and REST APIs. I previously worked on an open source collaborative software suite and its migration tools.
Technologies used: Java, Spring Framework, Spring Boot, JUnit, Rest and SOAP APIs, Oracle, LDAP, AWS, Linux servers, git, Jira

jobs.tittle: Full Stack Developer - Servers and Network Manager
li: University of El Salvador (Universidad de El Salvador - Facultad Multidisciplinaria de Occidente)
description: I supported and updated Web Systems built with Java EE and JSP. Also, I supported all the internal and external services, including: IP Telephony (Asterisk), Internet and local networks, Moodle Virtual Classrooms, DNS, Firewall, Internal Applications running on docker containers, Mail accounts, and Wireless Networks.
Technologies used: Java, Java EE, JSP, JUnit, Rest and SOAP APIs, MySQL, postgreSQL, LDAP, Linux servers, docker, git

jobs.tittle: Full Stack Developer - Servers and Network Management Assistant
li: University of El Salvador (Universidad de El Salvador - Facultad Multidisciplinaria de Occidente)
description: During this time, I helped migrating and updating legacy web systems written in Java EE and JSP. I also assisted configuring and maintaining the following services: IP Telephony (Asterisk), Internet and local networks, Moodle Virtual Classrooms, Security Cameras, and Wireless Networks.
Technologies used: Java, Java EE, JSP, JUnit, Rest and SOAP APIs, MySQL, postgreSQL, LDAP, Linux servers, docker, git

summary: I develop multiplatform mobile applications (Android & iOS) and Web Systems using Java with Spring Boot and React
My goal is to create scalable, reliable, and efficient software that provides a seamless user experience

list.title: ECO Library
ps: Developed to cover the specific needs of a prestigious private school. Provides students with the ability to search books with various filtering options and to register media usage. Administrative users can manage books, authors, publishers, tags, book loans, and access reports.

One of the key elements in this project was keeping the user experience simple, so that the software was intuitive and easy to use for everybody, even the youngest students, without compromising functionality.

list.title: WiMouse
ps: All-in-one remote control. Features a precise touchpad, media controls, and a fully featured keyboard. Highly customizable, it was designed to be easy to setup and use

list.title: Webcam4all
ps: This Android app turns the user's phone into a 1080p wireless webcam for Windows or macOS. It takes every frame from the camera, encodes it into JPEG, and sends it over HTTP to the client through the local network.
The biggest challenge was to provide a low latency, fault-tolerant, and reliable stream of data while maintaining the image quality.

list.title: WiMouse Website
ps: Created to showcase the app and how to set it up.

list.title: WiMouse Server
ps: Desktop application created to receive mouse and keyboard events from Wimouse App and execute them on the computer. It's a cross-platform application written in NodeJS using the Electron Framework and RobotJS library

list.title: Webcam4all Website
ps: Created to showcase the app and how to set it up.

list.title: This site
list.printDescription: It is the online version of this document. Check it out for a more interactive experience.

list.title: 3D modelling
ps: I create 3D models in my free time. They're available for purchase at Turbosquid, the biggest 3D models marketplace. I use Blender for modelling and Substance Painter for texturing. I've also used Cinema 4D in the past.
